description.message: Reload an unpacked extension with one click, hotkey or automatically.

ports_help_text.message: Ports separated by commas that should expect messages to reload extensions. You will need multiple ports if you develop multiple extensions.

click_action_help_text_chrome.message:
An object that defines what happens when you click on the browser action icon or hit "Reload extension main" hotkey specified at chrome://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Whether to reload an extension as opposed to just reloading the current tab. If set to false, the background script will not reload. The extension(s) won't reload on manifest.json changes even if this option is true unless you use listen() function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" supplementary package in the background script of the target extension. Can be combined with "all_tabs".

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Whether to reload all tabs as opposed to just reloading the current tab.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
An id of an extension to reload in "hard" mode. If unspecified, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_sound: boolean
default: false
Whether to play a notification sound upon reload completion.

after_reload_delay: number
default: 1000
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait after an extension was reloaded before reloading closed tabs. If you experience any errors in your extension after its pages are reloaded or the extension's pages are reloaded blank, you may try to increase this value.

Example:
{
    "all_tabs": false,
    "hard": true,
    "ext_id": "ffhljpfecjcfjdaneehmhdgplkaafnbb",
    "play_sound": true
}

click_action_help_text_edge.message:
An object that defines what happens when you click on the browser action icon or hit "Reload extension main" hotkey specified at edge://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Whether to reload an extension as opposed to just reloading the current tab. If set to false, the background script will not reload. The extension(s) won't reload on manifest.json changes even if this option is true unless you use listen() function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" supplementary package in the background script of the target extension. Can be combined with "all_tabs".

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Whether to reload all tabs as opposed to just reloading the current tab.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
An id of an extension to reload in "hard" mode. If unspecified, all extensions will be reloaded.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
An id of an extension to reload in "hard" mode. If unspecified, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_sound: boolean
default: false
Whether to play a notification sound upon reload completion.

after_reload_delay: number
default: 1000
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait after an extension was reloaded before reloading closed tabs. If you experience any errors in your extension after its pages are reloaded or the extension's pages are reloaded blank, you may try to increase this value.

Example:
{
    "all_tabs": false,
    "hard": true,
    "ext_id": "ffhljpfecjcfjdaneehmhdgplkaafnbb",
    "play_sound": true
}

context_menu_actions_help_text.message: An array of objects with the same schema as seen in "Extension's icon click action" that define additional reload actions that appear in the browser action context menu. Keep in mind that there is a limit on how many items can appear there. You can also use reload actions defined here by hitting one of the "Reload extension X" hotkeys, where X is a position in the array.

invalid_reload_action_input_error_text.message: Invalid settings. Click on the ? button to see the list of allowed poperties. Make sure you provided a valid JSON. Invalid settings won't be saved.
